meanings.definition: To decide or announce that a planned event will not take place.
meanings.sent1: I had to cancel my birthday party due to the rain.
meanings.sent2: She will cancel the meeting if too many people are absent.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to cancel the disappearing act, but it still happened.
meanings.sent4: His apology couldn't cancel the hurtful words he said.
meanings.sent5: The storm's intensity forced us to cancel our outdoor plans.

meanings.definition: To delete or remove a scheduled item from a list.
meanings.sent1: Please cancel the incorrect item from the shopping list.
meanings.sent2: I need to cancel the appointment I made for tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The computer glitch seemed to cancel the important data entry.
meanings.sent4: The eraser can cancel out any mistakes on the paper.
meanings.sent5: He had to cancel one task to make time for another urgent one.

meanings.definition: To neutralize or offset the effect of something.
meanings.sent1: Eating a snack can cancel out hunger before dinner.
meanings.sent2: The medicine can cancel the side effects of the treatment.
meanings.sent3: The laughter from the audience seemed to cancel the actor's nerves.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness canceled the negativity in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors cancel the dullness of the room's decor.
